definition: to make up (one's face)/to dress/(of one's dress) beautiful

sentences.english: Kiddy ! Why did you rob our money bag?
sentences.chinese: 你個靚妹做什麼搶我們的袋錢呀？

sentences.english: Today, I went to a rock concert and met this amazing girl.
sentences.chinese: 今天我去聽搖滾音樂會，遇到一個靚妹。

sentences.english: Way We beg you to help the next guy is busy.
sentences.chinese: 懇求各位帥哥靚妹幫下忙。

sentences.english: Fat lady, big mama, Missy Bimbo sits in her chair and yawns.
sentences.chinese: 胖女，肥媽，靚妹坐在椅子上打哈欠。

sentences.english: While waiting there, he saw two pretty girls come out of the building.
sentences.chinese: 等在那兒時，他看見兩個靚妹走出大樓。
靚妹，我現在有一定困難。

definition: La Comédie humaine, series of novels by 19th century French novelist Honoré de Balzac 巴爾扎克|巴尔扎克[Ba1 er3 zha1 ke4]
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
a drum-shaped rattle (used by peddlers or as a toy)/rattle-drum
(slang) (usu. of a woman) sb who looks stunning from behind/sb who has a great figure but not necessarily an attractive face/abbr. to 背殺|背杀[bei4 sha1]
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
lit. a girl changes eighteen times between childhood and womanhood (idiom)/fig. a young woman is very different from the little girl she once was
(slang) to target an intoxicated person for sexual assault
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
